intro: Brassica cheiranthos, commonly known as the heart-shaped cabbage or winter cabbage, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are heart-shaped and often hairy. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are characteristic of the mustard family. Its fruits are pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Brassica cheiranthos is native to Europe and is cultivated for its edible leaves and as a forage crop.
